summary: This document is a chain of emails from October 2019 between FBI Victim Services Division personnel and a law firm representing a confidential victim of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails coordinate the victim's attendance at an FBI briefing for Epstein victims, with discussions about security protocols, confidentiality, and logistics for meetings in Miramar, Florida and New York.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the FBI briefings; the perpetrator whose victims are being invited to attend the meetings.

events.title: FBI Victim Briefing in Miramar
events.description: The FBI Victim Services Division hosts a briefing for identified victims of Jeffrey Epstein at the Miami Field Office.

events.title: FBI Victim Briefing in New York
events.description: The FBI Victim Services Division hosts a briefing for identified victims of Jeffrey Epstein at the New York Field Office.

keyFacts: The FBI Victim Services Division organized confidential briefings for identified victims of Jeffrey Epstein in October 2019.
A law firm was representing at least one confidential victim whose identity had never been publicly released.
The FBI required detailed personal information (including Social Security Number) for security clearance to attend the briefings at federal buildings.
The document highlights the ongoing victim outreach and coordination efforts by the FBI following Epstein's arrest and death.
